items.name: Ext.app.ViewModel
data
items.text:
This object holds the arbitrary data that populates the `ViewModel` and is
then available for binding.

items.name: formulas
links
parent
items.text: The parent `ViewModel` of this `ViewModel`. Once set, this cannot be changed.

items.name: root
items.text: A reference to the root "stub" (an object that manages bindings).

items.name: scheduler
items.text: The scheduler used to schedule and manage the delivery of notifications for all connections to this `ViewModel` and any other attached to it. The normal process to initialize the scheduler is to get the scheduler used by the parent or session and failing either of those, create one.

items.name: schema
items.text: The schema to use for getting information about entities.

items.name: session
items.text: The session used to manage the data model (records and stores).

items.name: stores
view
items.text: The Container that owns this `ViewModel` instance.

items.name: bind
descriptor
items.text:
The bind descriptor. See class description
for details.

items.name: callback
items.text: The function to call with the value of the bound property.

items.name: scope
items.text: The scope (`this` pointer) for the `callback`.

items.name: options
items.text: Additional options to configure the Ext.app.bind.Binding. If this parameter is provided, the `bindTo` form of combining options and bind descriptor is not recognized.
The binding.

items.name: constructor
items.text: Creates new Object.

items.name: value
items.text: The value to wrap.

items.name: get
items.text: Get a value from the data for this viewmodel.

items.name: path
items.text:
The path of the data to retrieve.

   var value = vm.get('theUser.address.city');
The data stored at the passed path.

items.name: getId
items.text: Retrieves the id of this component. Will autogenerate an id if one has not already been set.
id

items.name: getRecord
items.text:
Get a record instance given a reference descriptor. Will ask
the session if one exists.

items.name: type
items.text: The model type.

items.name: id
items.text: The model id.
The model instance.

items.name: getSession
items.text: Gets the session attached to this (or a parent) ViewModel. See the session configuration.
The session. null if no session exists.

items.name: getStore
items.text: Gets a store configured via the stores configuration.

items.name: key
items.text: The name of the store.
The store. null if no store exists.

items.name: getStub
items.text: This method looks up the `Stub` for a single bind descriptor.

items.name: bindDescr
items.text: The bind descriptor.
The `Stub` associated to the bind descriptor.

items.name: hasOwnProperty
prop
items.text: The name of the property to test.

Returns true if object contains specified property; else
returns false.

items.name: isPrototypeOf
prototype
items.text:
an object to be tested against each link in the prototype chain of the
*object* argument

items.name: object
items.text: the object whose prototype chain will be searched
Returns true if object is a prototype and false if not.

items.name: linkTo
items.text: Create a link to a reference. See the links configuration.

items.name: key
items.text: The name for the link.

items.name: reference
items.text: The reference descriptor.

items.name: notify
items.text:
Forces all bindings in this ViewModel hierarchy to evaluate immediately. Use this to do a synchronous flush
of all bindings.

items.name: propertyIsEnumerable
prop
items.text: The name of the property to test.

If the object does not have the specified property, this
method returns false.

items.name: set
items.text: Set  a value in the data for this viewmodel.

items.name: path
items.text:
The path of the value to set, or an object literal to set
at the root of the viewmodel.

items.name: value
toLocaleString
items.text: Returns a string representing the object. This method is meant to be overridden by derived objects for locale-specific purposes. Objects toLocaleString returns the result of calling toString. This function is provided to give objects a generic toLocaleString method, even though not all may use it. Currently, only Array, Number, and Date override toLocaleString.
Object represented as a string.

items.name: toString

items.text: Object represented as a string.

items.name: valueOf
items.text: Returns the primitive value of the specified object. JavaScript calls the valueOf method to convert an object to a primitive value. You rarely need to invoke the valueOf method yourself; JavaScript automatically invokes it when encountering an object where a primitive value is expected. By default, the valueOf method is inherited by every object descended from Object. Every built- in core object overrides this method to return an appropriate value. If an object has no primitive value, valueOf returns the object itself, which is displayed as: [object Object] You can use valueOf within your own code to convert a built-in object into a primitive value. When you create a custom object, you can override `Object.valueOf` to call a custom method instead of the default Object method. You can create a function to be called in place of the default valueOf method. Your function must take no arguments. Suppose you have an object type `myNumberType` and you want to create a valueOf method for it. The following code assigns a user-defined function to the object's valueOf method: myNumberType.prototype.valueOf = new Function(functionText) With the preceding code in place, any time an object of type `myNumberType` is used in a context where it is to be represented as a primitive value, JavaScript automatically calls the function defined in the preceding code. An object's valueOf method is usually invoked by JavaScript, but you can invoke it yourself as follows: myNumber.valueOf() Note: Objects in string contexts convert via the toString method, which is different from String objects converting to string primitives using valueOf. All objects have a string conversion, if only `"[object type]"`. But many objects do not convert to number, boolean, or function.
Returns value of the object or the object itself.

items.name: constructor
data
items.text: This object holds all of the properties of this `ViewModel`. It is prototype chained to the linkData which is, in turn, prototype chained to (if present) the `data` object of the parent `ViewModel`.

items.name: factoryConfig
items.text: If this property is specified by the target class of this mixin its properties are used to configure the created Ext.Factory.

items.name: linkData
items.text:
This object is used to hold the result of a linked value. This is done
so that the data object hasOwnProperty equates to whether or not this
property is owned by this instance or inherited.

items.name: prototype
items.text: Allows the addition of properties to all objects of type Object.
